snippet: Women and children die at significantly higher rates than male passengers and crew members in maritime disasters, a review of historical records suggests.
abstract: Study of historical records published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that in maritime disasters, women and children die at significantly higher rates than male passengers and crew members.
lead_paragraph: Women and children die at significantly higher rates than male passengers and crew members in maritime disasters, a review of historical records suggests.

headline.seo: Law of the Sea? Women and Children Fare Poorly in Ship Disasters
headline.main: In Crises at Sea, Chivalry Dies First
headline.print_headline: In Crises At Sea, Chivalry Dies First

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
